text: Has anyone compiled a newer car features dataset?  <http://cars.com|cars.com> has a _very_ impressive API and comprehensive dataset that their website uses for <https://www.cars.com/research/compare>…  it’s actually grabbing JSONs from <https://developer.cars.com/apis|api.cars.com>! But it’s proprietary :disappointed:. Did they aggregate this themselves?

attachments.title: Car Comparison Tool | Cars.com
attachments.text: Compare MSRP, invoice prices, crash test results, mileage and available transmissions side-by-side for up to 4 cars, trucks, minivans, vans or SUVs.

attachments.title: Predicting Car Auction Prices with Machine Learning
attachments.text: About 10 days ago, I saw a post for a ridiculously cute car of a make and model that I previously did not know existed:
attachments.fallback: Medium: Predicting Car Auction Prices with Machine Learning

text: I would be interested in anything you find. I know Frank Verboven shares data on the European Car market (1970-1999) but they request that the data can only be used for academic research (+acknowledge the source).

elements.text: I would be interested in anything you find. I know Frank Verboven shares data on the European Car market (1970-1999) but they request that the data can only be used for academic research (+acknowledge the source).

text: I’m asking rather selfishly — I’m suddenly in the market for a new (used) car and am manually exfiltrating the JSONs from that comparison tool to just get a lay of the land since it’s been a long time since I’ve been in the market and I’m looking in an unfamiliar segment

text: but also unselfishly, that dataset is really cool and would make for great tutorials/demos/examples

text: The selfish usecase is covered by their TOS, the unselfish one not :disappointed:
